document.docAuthor: Mantelatto, Fernando L., Tamburus, Ana Francisca, Magalhães, Tatiana, Buranelli, Raquel C., Terossi, Mariana, Negri, Mariana, Castilho, Antonio L., Costa, Rogério C. & Zara, Fernando J.
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: III. Infraorder Brachyura Latreille, 1802

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of decapod crustaceans from the coast of the São Paulo state (Brazil) supported by integrative molecular and morphological data: III. Infraorder Brachyura Latreille, 1802

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined.
Brazil , São Paulo : 1 ♀ , CCDB 6542 , Santos ,
Laje de Santos
, colls. T . Davanso et al. ,
vi.2015
.

Remarks. Previous records on the coast of São Paulo include Ilha Vitória and Ilha das Couves as
Xanthodius denticulatus
(
Alves et al. 2006
; 2012a ). New combination to
Williamstimpsonia
was proposed by Števčić (2011) .

Herein we presented species which were inferred to occur on the coast of São Paulo state based on the assumption of continuous distribution ranges along the Brazilian coast that include this state (e.g., Melo 1990 , 1996 , 1998). As consequence, some following studies replicated their occurrence in São Paulo state without further checking (e.g.,
Melo et al. 1998
, 2008, 2010). In some cases, the species was mentioned in technical research report or scientific journal, but with no information about the voucher catalogue in crustacean collection. Thus, pending future and detailed investigation, we suggest that the inferences of their presence in São Paulo are erroneous/doubtful and should not be considered at least until records are appropriately reported ( Table 3 ). However, despite our efforts to check the vast literature pointing to the coast of São Paulo state , as well as some of Brazilian main scientific collections, we cannot rule out the hypothesis that any of the species not recorded by us have been collected in the past and be deposited in any collection in the country or abroad that we were not able to analyze during our study.

caption.paragraph: TABLE 3. Brachyurans species (N = 27) whose occurrence in São Paulo state was removed due replicated occurrence without further checking and/or no information about the voucher catalogue in crustacean collection. Brazilian states: (AP) Amapá, (PA) Pará, (MA) Maranhão, (PI) Piauí, (CE) Ceará, (RN) Rio Grande do Norte, (PR) Paraíba, (PE) Pernambuco, (AL) Alagoas, (SE) Sergipe, (BA) Bahia, (ES) Espírito Santo, (RJ) Rio de Janeiro, (SP) São Paulo, (PR) Paraná, (SC) Santa Catarina, (RS) Rio Grande do Sul. * Family with no species registered for São Paulo in the present study.
